If you're in the mood for a quirky and witty comedy, I'd highly recommend "The Trouble with Harry" (1955). It's a classic Alfred Hitchcock film that pokes fun at societal norms and features some amazing cameos from big names like Jerry Mathers and John Forsythe. Plus, who can resist a mystery surrounding a dead body?

Or, if you're looking for something a bit more offbeat, I think "The Truman Show" (1998) might be up your alley. This Jim Carrey-starring film is a clever commentary on reality TV and features some fantastic performances from its talented cast. It's a thought-provoking and entertaining ride that will keep you guessing until the very end!
